model_input:
Your task is to choose the better response based on the below criterion.
You will be given a list of past memories, a current conversation between two individuals, and two options of next responses.

CRITERION:
Consistency - The response should not contain information that contradicts the past memory.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the response that has better Consistency given the past memories and current conversation.

PAST MEMORIES:
Speaker A is retired and spends most days hiking.
Speaker B is a college student who plays soccer with other students.
Speaker B's mother runs a local high school, and Speaker B is her only child.
Speaker A mentions their neighbor John who loves soccer.
Speaker A and Speaker B discuss the importance of treating everyone equally.
Speaker A does not care for voting, leading to a discussion with Speaker B about it.
Speaker A is older, mentioning the competitiveness of college sports now compared to when they were growing up.
Speaker B is studying sports medicine and plays soccer, looking to join their college team in the future.
Speaker B is looking for internships in the sports medicine field and has asked professors for letters of recommendation.
Speaker A enjoys hiking along the coast and collecting shells, mentioning that their knees can't handle much else.
Speaker B has been going to the beach a lot and is learning to surf from friends in Jersey.
Speaker A used to surf when they were younger, while Speaker B is currently not good at it.
Speaker A used to surf and is trying to get back into it.
Speaker B is a beginner surfer getting help from experienced friends.
Speaker A is interested in getting tips from locals and knows someone named John who could help.
Speaker B is training for soccer and hopes to make the school team as a walk-on player.
Speaker B is focused on building stamina and sharp reflexes for soccer.
Speaker B's professors have been supportive in writing letters for an internship application.
Speaker A is offering advice and encouragement to Speaker B regarding the internship hunt, mentioning the medical field.
Speaker B is struggling with finding internships and feels like they are at a disadvantage compared to others with connections.
Speaker B is interested in sports medicine and enjoys surfing.
Speaker A suggests that surfing could be a way for Speaker B to make connections in the medical field.
Speaker B jokes about pretending to get hurt surfing to meet a doctor, showing a sense of humor and creativity.

CURRENT CONVERSATION:
Speaker A: I met this guy at work who's wife is an athletic trainer, they asked me to pass their info on to you to discuss possible internships!
Speaker B: That would be great- thanks so much!   I have searched online a lot for internships but it is tricky in my field.  What do you do for a living in the medical field?
Speaker A: You are so welcome. I am retired now but I was a PA- physician assistant. Now I enjoy hanging out at the beach. With my knees the way they are the ocean water seems to make them feel better. So how much longer before you graduate?
Speaker B: I have another year- so this year is really important I get internships and start making connections in the field.   I love going to the beach too.  What happened with your knees that now cause you so much pain?
Speaker A: I think age has really been my knees downfall. I also used to hike a lot and I put a lot of pressure on my legs. That is great that you only have a year. Maybe when you graduate you can come hang out on the beach with me. I can't surf but I would love to watch you.
Speaker B: That would be fun!  I like collecting shells too so we could do that as well.  I have a small collection of ones I have from around the world.  The farthest away was from Greece.  Have you traveled a lot?
Speaker A: I have. I love Europe. I have been to many countries there but I have not gone to Greece yet. I would love to. The scenery and architecture is amazing. Have you gotten to visit other European countries?
Speaker B: I have.   I have also been to France and Ireland.  Where have you been in Europe?
Speaker A: Oh gosh. I have been to France, England, Ireland, Switzerland, Austria, Poland, Germany, Leichenstein, Spain, and much of Mexico, and Bermuda. I just love to travel but I have not been able to recently and with my knees I cannot sit in coach anymore and first class is so expensive. Do you plan on settling any place in particular once you graduate? 
Speaker B: That's awesome you have been so many places!   I  am not sure where I will setlle down after graduation.  It probably will depend whether I decide to go further in my education or not and I have any residency requirements with that.   I do like the heat though so  hopefully somewhere sunny!
Speaker A: Oh I forgot my most favorite place- Italy. I am sure you will have so many opportunities when you graduate. You will have people knocking down your door. You could go anywhere with that degree. WOuld you like Florida? I personally cannot deal with that much heat but sounds like you would like it there. My brother lives in Cape Coral on one of the canals and he loves it. Other than FLorida what other warm place would you like? 

RESPONSE 1
Speaker B: I've always dreamed of visiting Australia or Hawaii. The beaches and outdoor activities there seem incredible. What about you? Any warm places you'd like to explore next?
RESPONSE 2
Speaker B:  It's great to hear that you enjoy going to the beach too! I used to surf when I was younger, and actually, I've been thinking about taking out my old surfboard and hitting the waves again. It's never too late to get back into something you love, right? Let's plan a surfing day together once you graduate and we can collect some shells too. I'm sure we'll have a blast!

YOUR OUTPUT:
Explanation:
prediction:
Explanation: 
In the past memories, it is mentioned that Speaker B is a beginner surfer currently getting help from friends and that Speaker A used to surf when they were younger and is trying to get back into it. However, Response 2 incorrectly states that Speaker B used to surf when they were younger, which contradicts the memories indicating they are currently a beginner surfer. Response 1 does not contradict any past memories, as Speaker B has not specifically expressed a past desire to visit Australia or Hawaii, and their interest in warm places aligns with the current conversation.

Choice: 1
